Bio

I am a researcher at OpenAI.

I received my Ph.D. in Computer Science from Stanford University advised by Diyi Yang and Dora Demszky where my work is recognized by the 2025 Economic Report of the President. Previously, I earned my B.Sc. in Computer Science from MIT where I worked with Profs. Josh Tenenbaum and Jonathan How.

Recent News

February 2025: Invited talk at Princeton University Computer Science.
February 2025: Invited talk at University of Washington CSE (recording).
February 2025: Research featured in Education Week, The New Teachers' Aides: AI Tutors.
February 2025: Published an article on the future of human learning in the age of AI. Featured on the Inter-American Development Bank (translated in Spanish).
January 2025: Two works, Tutor CoPilot and Bridge, are cited in the 2025 Economic Report of the President.
December 2024: Invited talk at UC Berkeley EECS
December 2024: Tutor CoPilot is recognized in the 74's Charts that Defined Education in 2024.
December 2024: Invited talk at UT Austin
November 2024: ‚ú® Highlighted as a Leader in AI & Education by AI for Education.
November 2024: Two grants awarded by the Gates Foundation to continue work on (a) developing AI and Education benchmarks and (b) developing Language CoPilots.
November 2024: Invited talk at MIT
November 2024: Invited talk at UC Berkeley, Graduate School of Education
October 2024: Want to build your own Tutor CoPilot? I released code, Colab notebook and tutorial video showing how to!
October 2024: Tutor CoPilot research primer video is released. Watch it here.
October 2024: Tutor CoPilot, the first large-scale intervention of Human-AI approach in live tutoring with 1,800 K12 students and 900 tutors is released. ‚ú®üëâ News coverage includes MIT Technology Review, Education Week, the 74, K-12 Dive, MarkTechPost, Dan Meyer's blog, Stanford Accelerator for Learning.
